attrs.description: "For Peshawar" selected as finalist for a 2016 Online Journalism Award. The Express Tribune was the only individual news organization from outside the U.S., Canada and Europe to be shortlisted for this year’s awards.

attrs.description:
In Puebla, Mexico, Ernesto Arujo, founder of Plan B, which is a reginal news site, launched and successfully reached his Kickstarter goal in his first crowdfunding campaign, which ended in mid December. Ernesto joined Janine's team as Mexican Ambassador in November. Ernesto benefitted from his participation in the MOOC, from the tips he read a column on crowdfunding that we published in our SebraMedia Medium blog, and from private conversations with Mij as he set up and managed the campaign


managed the campaignan
Blog post by SembraMedia - The first year of SembraMedia!
Chris Guess encouraged Bivol to sign agreement to formally join OCCRP
attrs.additional_notes:
Bivol had been informally involved with OCCRP. They were on the mailing list but didn’t have legal cooperation. They got on board with memorandum of understanding. Gives them better standing within the org.
Access to resources, internal research and documentation + Push. Chris was supposed to follow-up and ask Bivol if MOU has led to any other substantial changes

attrs.description: India Spend hired 2 frontend developers. They also hired a social media producer. Irshad worked on job descriptions

Geo News uses Dataminr for two week free trial. Shaheryar says the digital team "loves it" and will likely start paying money for it. Dataminr helped them to beat the TV team on some stories. (Usually TV covers it first and then digital reposts/adapts the content for web.)
attrs.additional_notes: Shaheryar to send links to the stories where web beat TV.

attrs.description: Janine Warner will lead a two-day workshop on digital entrepreneurship for a group of Bolivian journalists in collaboration with La Fundación para el Periodismo
attrs.additional_notes:
Did event happen? 

More info:
 Details about my trip to Santa Cruz, Bolivia, next week: I leave LA Saturday, Aug 5 and return the following Friday, Aug. 11. As usual, I'll check email and WhatsApp while traveling, but it will be hard for me to schedule any meetings that week. I'll be back in LA the following week with a much more flexible schedule. While in Bolivia, I will be working with the La Fundación para el Periodismo, which is headed by Renen Estessoro. (FYI - the initial connection came from our mutual friend, and I believe former ICFJ Fellow, Hena Cuevas). Renen originally asked me to do a series of workshops on investigative journalism - I recommended that he hire Fabiola for that instead and she and David Hidalgo split the 5 seminars between them and presented them in April. I am going now to do a follow up seminar on Entrepreneurial Journalism to help Renen develop an online media site at the Foundation, as well as to support the efforts of a selected group of participants from Fabiola and David's workshops. By wonderful coincidence, Carlos Huertes of Connectas will also be in Santa Cruz at the same time, so in addition to the 2-day workshop I will be running on Entrepreneurial journalism, I will also be sharing the stage with Carlos for an event at the Universidad NUR de Santa Cruz - he and I will each give 1.5 hour presentations that evening for students, faculty, and the public.

attrs.description: This is the 13th item (a column) in the series about a perspective of a woman -who has been a part of corporate sector for a long time- reflecting into what ails the corporate sector in India from the point of view of gender.
PurePeriodismo 2016 roundup of interviews with experts - “The 2016 Balance of Puroperiodismo”
The Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism at Oxford featured ICFJ Knight Fellow Nasr Hadi's projects with the Hindustan Times in its "India Newspapers' Digital Transition" report.
Janine Warner led a webinar for digital entrepreneurs with FNPI
attrs.additional_notes: Any more details we can get on this?

attrs.description: 17th story in the series: This opinion piece by Jagmati Sangwan, a social activist and a former international volleyball player for India, brings to the fore the problems with 'Beti Bachao beti padhao'- Indian government's flagship scheme to promote birth of girl child and her education. Also, Govt of India's initiative of forming a task force with a mandate to prepare a long term roadmap for the next three Olympics and a short term strategy for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics does not have a single woman in its team. She uses her experience and the amount of funds spent on the scheme and correlates with experiences on the field, which clearly show that the program is not benefiting the target group. Her observations as a former volleyball player are interesting in the wake of the fantastic show of women in the Olympics, where the women won despite the system and not because of it.
SembraMedia produced a case study on Side B
Geo News did its second FB Live video without Shaheryar in the studio
attrs.additional_notes: Quote from Shaheryar: Geo News just recently started out with Facebook Live sessions. The first Live video was for their morning show with one of Pakistan’s most famous cricketers. It was a post-show Facebook Live session where the show’s hosts had a short Q & A with the guest based on questions asked on social media. It did really well overall. After that they branched out into headlines for their 6pm and 9ppm bulletins and some breaking news. This has been important for Geo News because they are a broadcast channel and with the help of Facebook Live they will now be able to tap into a wider digital audience as well, focusing on original content for digital and content that is already being transmitted on television.

attrs.description: Janine Warner's Oct 2016 entrepreneurship MOOC with the Knight Center helped to inspire a participant to launch a new news site in Argentina called Antithesis.
Geo's sports coverage is the 1st time Periscope is used for news in Pakistan.
HT Labs story using Atavist, a tool that Nasr helped to introduce to the newsroom.
attrs.additional_notes: Got people from other parts of Zee that have started to attend. Looking to integrate other web brands into WION.

attrs.description: SembraMedia produced a case study on Chequeado
Sprout Social has become HT's “primary platform for social publishing and analytics.”
attrs.additional_notes:
Before HT used FB native scheduling tools + Tweetdeck, wasn’t consolidated.
Sprout is allowing them to distribute social workflow out across the newsroom so that individual reporters and editors can take more ownership of HT-branded social media. 
Social team’s role is evolving to “take charge of driving the most important stories of the day or maybe big planned packages” while providing creative review for other desks.

attrs.description: Usage of Google's MyMaps and other bar charts.
Details about JL's security training with Connectas - see notes
attrs.additional_notes:
JL trained them to use PGP when he was in Bogota. Connected JL for follow-up training for Panama Papers.
Started to use encryption systems during Panama Papers investigations.
JL trained them to produce PGP keys and use digital security tools. They were using Hushmail.
Carlos needed PGP key for Panama Papers, contacted JL immediately and JL helped him to reopen the application/find key to send to ICIJ.
Website was hacked and they were offline for several days. Carlos contacted JL and JL set them up with Deflect. Haven’t had any other major digital security incident since then.

attrs.additional_notes: When did it actually launch? Supposed to soft launch in June, hard launch in September

attrs.description: Jorge Luis hosts border security workshop in Ciudad Juarez, MX. 27 journalists attended (3 from U.S.).

This is the first of the story under the series #NoTobacco that will be carried in Dainik Jagran owing to World No Tobacco day on March 31st. The team initiated the Jagran staff to think about the stories visually. This campaign will have Indian stock images and with hashtags on them for the first time.

This is the third story in the #GenderAnd series. Most of the data stories that Indian Express carried till the recent past have been around gender and violence against women. This story which was an intersection of data, education and gender bucked the general trend within Indian Express. This story was number 1 on LinkedIN for a week. This story with maximum amount of social interaction (5.5k) in the whole series. Also got the highest FB interaction.
Usage of the following google tools in the story: embedded maps created in Google Fusion Tables, YouTube.  This also needed extra coding.
Shaheryar Popalzai spoke on the ISOJ 2017 panel: Video everywhere - Live, VR, and 360

attrs.description:
What follows is a collection of testimonials from Janine's MOOC

"Las ideas compartidas en cuanto a alternativas de financiamiento y de manejo de equipos de colaboradores, charladas también en el taller de coaching" - Marcela Basch, El plan c. (Argentina)
"Si, como idea principal, tomar como referencia los métodos de financiamiento de otros medios (..) Lo principal para nosotros es poder lograr financiamiento para mejorar el sitio, para sumar contenido de mayor calidad.y además ampliar la audiencia." - Guillermina, Escritura Crónica. (Argentina)
"Reforzar la idea de la diversificación del origen de los ingresos. (..) Quedó demostrado a través de los proyectos presentados que el modelo de negocio se va formando luego de intentar diversas estrategias, y en apuntar sólo a una." - Darío Drucaroff, ex alumno del MOOC, fundador de CanalAR y Argenieros (Argentina)
"Estrategias de financiamiento, propuestas periodística del medios, producción de contendios y trabajo en redes. Son los concepto o ideas que pudimos trasladar para enriquecer el debate en nuestro proyecto (..) porque son cuestiones que están lejos de tener una respuesta concreta, satisfactoria y estable" - Nahuel Lag, revista NAN (Argentina)
"Monetización" - Javier Sadir, La Palta
"Estrategias de monetización" - Georgina Elustondo, Buena Vibra
This is the fourth story under the #GenderAnd series. (Will fill in more details later.)
Janine Warner produced a short training video explaining business models in Spanish
NDTV quotes IndiaSpend data-driven journalism story about the legacy of a controversial politician.
attrs.additional_notes: Irshad is helping IndiaSpend to think through the process of promoting viral stories like this one. Strategy is to come up with one story per week that will do really well and significantly drive up traffic numbers. Irshad is also helping them to create full packages about top performing stories to maximize reach and impact, i.e. also doing Facebook Live video about this story.

attrs.description: Jorge Luis conducts a risk assessment for El Noroeste de Culiacan in Sinaloa, a state well known as a top producer of marijuana and heroin and home to the Sinaloa cartel. The newsroom has been attacked at least one time over the last two years. The editor was attacked wth firearms and was hurt in one leg two years ago. Although the media organization has a security policy to run drug trafficking stories, there is no security policy for the rest of the newsroom. It is the first time El Noroeste conducts a risk assessment.
attrs.additional_notes: preliminary data: https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/0B8CoCX5dMCJFRWw1QU1uRVdHYlU

attrs.description: This is second story in the #GenderAnd series.
First HT story that involved scraping a large data set
Janine Warner was interviewed on digital entrepreneurship by Plazacatorce.com in Bolivia
This was Ravi and Venkatesh's first story effort in Dainik Jagran's health section. Dainik Jagran used this tool- Quiz.JS developed by Pykih-  for the first time.

Janine has been able to increase Nilsa’s monthly honorarium. Thanks to her higher honorarium, she was able to rent an office last month, which not gives her a place to meet with people she is interviewing, but also gives her a place to meet with potential advertising clients and donors. 
Moving the office out of her parent's home is a huge step for her and one that, combined with the training and coaching she's received from me and others on the SembraMedia team, is really helping her make progress as she works to develop a business model in the midst of one of the worst economic crises in the history of her country.
JL trained 34 EL Universal correspondents in Mexico. They’re in high risk situations. JL communicates with them via WhatsApp. Asked them to use Salama as first step.

Express Tribune Labs partnered with ICFJ Knight Fellow Shaheryar Popalzai to take viewers inside of Machar Colony, the largest slum in Karachi, Pakistan. An estimated one million residents live in the slum, which lacks most basic amenities. Made up of 12 separate stories, the project is the largest 360° video piece produced in Pakistan to date.
The 18th story in the series looks into the intersection of Gender and corporate India and analyses the issue of paygap in the sector.
Shaheryar Popalzai introduced Panotour to Geo TV, software for creating virtual tours, which they then purchased for the first time

"IndiaSpend has produced five Facebook Live studio broadcasts, most of which focused on PM Narendra Modi’s demonetization policies. They embedded some of them into a short story, which Business Standard republished. The third video hit 2,400 views on Facebook -- a 7x increase in number of views over their previous most watched video.  "

HT is using Parse.ly in daily news conferences and smaller team meetings. Now they have a set process for reviewing overnight and in the immediate preceding four hours so during top editors’ morning meeting and are running an analytics bot in Slack (built by news apps team). “Previously no substantive process, no scripted or standard process for bringing analytics into the news conversation," Nic Dawes said.
Blog post by SembraMedia - In Venezuela, the Rebel Alliance innovates commercially in independent journalism

Geo News adopted Facebook Live with the help of Shaheryar Popalzai, and has become one of the largest and most active Facebook Live setups, with reporters regularly broadcasting, exclusive shows and TV feeds
attrs.additional_notes:
Shaheryar's 7/19/2017 Slack to Patrick: 

We started working with Geo News last year on Facebook Live. For the pilot phase we broadcasted Live videos from the studio with newscasters reading the 6pm and 9pm bulletins, and this was later expanded to reporters in the field. Once things kicked off internally Geo’s Live strategy was expanded to included:

Porting their television feed straight to Facebook Live for headlines and breaking news situations
Porting clean feeds to Live from their satellite vans in the field
Shows created exclusively for Facebook Live using their current studio setup

No additional costs were incurred for their Live strategy implementation and all in-house resources were used.

They currently have one of the largest and most active Facebook Live setups, with reporters regularly broadcasting, exclusive shows and TV feeds.

Out of the 50 videos in the year since Geo started Facebook Live, 21 have been been Facebook Live and the rest news packages and digital videos. Geo has crossed the million mark twice with Facebook live:

News headlines from the studio (1.9 million views)
Television broadcast to Facebook Live (over 1 million views)

Content that has worked out for Geo News really well:

Breaking news
Hourly headlines
Sports
Food
Health

attrs.description: 21st story of the #GenderAND series: This is a piece by a researcher that tries to understand masculinities from an Indian context that is based on her work with an organisation that works on issues related to her work at center for heaslth and social justice, a non profit working on issues related ti gender justice, health and sexuality.

"IndiaSpend has produced five Facebook Live studio broadcasts, most of which focused on PM Narendra Modi’s demonetization policies. They embedded some of them into a short story, which Business Standard republished. The third video hit 2,400 views on Facebook -- a 7x increase in number of views over their previous most watched video.  "

The 16th story in the series is very timely. It explores multiple intersections of gender, education and disability. It's timely because India is all set to be governed under a new tax structure very soon and it will impact all her citizens in every way possible. The story highlights how tax systems can be gendered and can neglect the needs of marginalised groups of people by taxing things that are essential to their well-being. This is on the same lines of sanitary napkins and tampons being considered as "luxury item" in India. Something that is a familiar story in the US too.
Blog post by SembraMedia - The most visited sections of SembraMedia.org

attrs.description: SembraMedia and Google News Lab co-hosted an event on entrepreneurial journalism for Argentinian media, 40 media participated, Janine Warner indicated it was the first Google News Lab event in Latin America for digital natives
Chris Guess' Push app recognized in Meydan annual report
attrs.additional_notes: "In February, we launched our mobile app (both iOS and Android versions). We were very lucky to receive this free of charge through our partnership with the Organized Crime and CorrupGon ReporGng Project (OCCRP), and are grateful to Knight Fellow Christopher Guess for his work developing the app and the recent upgrade. Two-thirds of Meydan TV's web traﬃc in 2016 has come from mobile devices, and so an iniGaGve directed at mobile users is the most eﬀecGve point of intervenGon. An updated version was released in January 2017."

attrs.description: Janine Warner was interviewed by Glenda Umana, founder of GUC360.com, to speak about the impact of digital media in Latin America
HT in-depth section publishes story about female genital mutilation
attrs.additional_notes: Nic likes the integration of video and illustration + good storytelling, which he says “wouldn’t have been possible to do [at HT] before.”

attrs.description: HT publishes Wikipedia-style explainer about a high-profile murder case using template built by news apps team.
attrs.additional_notes: Nic talking about significance of this story: “One of the real problems we have in our journalism, it’s a problem in global journalism, it’s the problem which is the premise for a company like Vox in many ways is that we tend to drop readers into stories in the middle, without enough context, without enough information, and it’s very disempowering for them and you know, the Indian news cycle, it’s such a large country, such a complex country that very often context, explanation and giving people a clear people a clear point of traction in the story are sacrificed so we’ve tried in a few of these cases to use the little tools that the news apps team have built or use a more data intensive approach with them writing a bit of the code to address that gap, to address that Wikipedia gap in the news.”

attrs.description: Jorge Luis introduces Jitsi, Peerio, Cryptocat, and Signal to the El Universal freelancers. As of March 2016, they were starting to use Jitsi, Cryptocat and Signal.
attrs.additional_notes: Have they continued to use the tools? Are they making a difference for stories?

Dawn.com produced a 360 video on their own to bring audiences into Jodia Bazaar, from the perspective of a donkey cart. Shaheryar Popalzai had introduced 360 video to Dawn.
WION produces story app. Nasr used it to make a convincing case for why they need CS/UX talent in newsroom.

Janine Warner spoke on the panel Emerging Technologies, Platforms, and Initiatives at MOBILE MEDIA CULTURE IN THE AMERICAS:
THE DIGITAL DIVIDE event in Miami

This is an important story from especially because it tackles the issue of a young woman who finds herself multiply disadvantaged . Also, it is very topical in this region considering the violence Rohingyas face in Myanmar. The noteworthy part was even the print section of Indian Express took up the story. Also, stories initiated by web teams are rarely taken up by the print teams (in the newspaper). All on ground reports are usually print exclusives. Mostly because the web team rarely ventures out to report due to the overwhelming work load. What was different for this story (of the #GENDERAND series) was that the web team planned the story, edited the story, shaped the story in collaboration with the reporter and then timed it in a way that it can go both in print and web on the same day. The web exclusive ground report was planned for the first time by the web team and that then made its way into the paper. The web story is longer, 1200 words while the print version was only 500 words.
This story was boosted (paid promotion) on Facebook. 

Education stories are not just about campus reporting. Education stories also involve an intersection of larger social in

IndiaSpend achieved almost 2 million impressions on Twitter in November, a 118 percent increase over their October reach. Profile visits and mentions also more than doubled in November. Irshad has helped them to create a new social media strategy, which includes the live tweeting, more direct calls to action in tweets, tagging journalists and collaborators and sharing more topical content.
This is where all stories filed under #GenderAnd will be compiled
IndiaSpend does its second FB Live video. This one includes more complicated production techniques than the first, mainly "switching from the production control room."
The 9th story in the series. The first story in the series that looks at the intersection of gender and caste focusing on Dalit women.

WION launches digital-first TV station. They designed the newsroom how Nasr wanted, roles are set up how Nasr wanted. Will continue with training sessions focused on people picking up skills themselves so that they can do projects/skills themselves.
attrs.additional_notes:
“We got a TV newsroom to launch digital first and hire roles that aren’t traditionally in newsrooms”
Distribution hub - structured like online aggregation, ad agencies (replicated from other industries that are doing better than journos)
Improvement in news itself - lots of global news in English (that India would usually get from Guardian, NYT, WP, etc)
We’ve affected stories indirectly but building the organization’s structure/staff.
The way they aspire to produce news is different than other Indian sites (compare WION homepage to NYT, for example) and add angle of how does it affect Indian citizens, economy. Other Indian news orgs have significantly less world content than WION aspires to. Most world news in other publications is from wires or syndication partners. Nasr is recommending templates that they should use for stories (obituary, longform, etc)

attrs.description: This is the 11th story in the series. It's an opinion piece. This piece is important in the wake of the Modi government shutting down Women's studies department in a very abrupt manner. Protests followed and now the issue hangs in balance. Now we learn that they want to convert into a "family" studies department, which can only be understood as a huge setback to the women's movement in India. It's a classic example of the right wing  meddling with the education sector in India.

attrs.description: Irshad has completed four #InteractiveMondays training sessions at the Hindustan Times Mumbai newsroom, the largest bureau outside of the Delhi headquarters. The sessions focused on Fusion Tables; chart building and data visualization; data extraction, cleanup and collection; and the free Northwestern Knight Lab tools.
topics: New technology solutions (sensors, drones, bots, etc)

attrs.description: The Facebook post on IE FB page for the second story.
Janine Warner spoke at ISOJ 2017 on the panel "News startups and new business models: Innovation in the search of sustainability”
JL has trained ~80 border journalists so far (Tijuana, Ciudad Juarez and McAllen)

This is the 12th story in the series that explores the link between traditional Madhubani art form and the women behind it. This is not a news story per se but a look into the real life scenarios of the artists from a gender perspective.

Luis Muñoz, editor of the local new site, Cotopaxi Noticias (in rural Ecuador), participated in Janine's seminar last summer. Since she started her ICFJ Fellowship, he also participated in an online webinar that Janine hosted as a follow up. His site is considered especially necessary because it’s in the poorest area of the country where historically there have been little or no sources of local news. Thanks to Janine's seminar and webinar he has a growing understanding of how and why he needs to develop a business model and not just run his news site as a volunteer if he wants to have long-term impact. Among his new ideas for revenue, he is starting is a local business directory, where he can provide very low-cost ads to a wide range of local businesses

This is an announcement of the month long Gender& series in web edition of Indian Express on Facebook. The series will go on for the whole of June and will have one story every weekday making it a total of 22 stories in the month of June. Post the announcement, reporters from print and online teams in Indian Express (some even from other cities viz. Chandigarh, Chennai and the state of Kerala have expressed their interest to write.

JL hosts workshop for border security journalists in McAllex, TX -- 29 journalists participated, 20 Mexicans + 9 U.S. reporters. Reporters. They were coming for El Manana Nuevo Laredo, El Manana de Matamoros, Reynosa, Ciudad Victoria, Tampico, Monterrey (Proceso Magazine) and Mexico City, Frente Latino. Leader of red de periodistas de noroeste. On the US side we got participants from Houston Chronicle, San Antonio Express News, Corpus Christi, and McAllen.
The last story of the #GenderAND series, this story looks at women calling the shots in the world of Indian theatre and the gendered nature of it.

In a series of coaching session with two of the founders of Ojo Publico (including Fabiola Torres who is our ambassador in Peru), Janine has helped them better appreciate the importance of selling digital products
topics: Strengthened networks of journalists and technologists

After Venkatesh told Anika, a Nat Geo staffer about the GEN Hackathon, she arranged for a team to be sent to New York and the team won. Now they get to compete in the finals at Vienna.

Nieman Lab features Chis Guess' Push app

Freelancer in Oaxaca, MX was taking photos of a confrontation that involved the federal police. There was an exchange of fire, some demonstrators died and freelancer had photos of the incident. He returned to his home in MX City and realized he was under surveillance. His apartment was broken into and laptop + lens were stolen. He contacted JL who put him  in touch with the Rory Peck Trust. Rory Peck gave him a grant to replace the equipment and provided advice to help keep him safe.

The journalists shared photos and video interviews and compiled the tweets into two lead stories (1, 2) on their website.

attrs.description: The El Universal correspondent in Hermosillo, Sonora, had her phone and laptop hacked in September. A spy was opening the web cam, shutting down her computer and erasing information. Jorge Luis recommended a technical security expert to the reporter and her editor. The technologist has wiped the laptop clean and is looking into how the computer was hacked and what information was compromised. The editor and correspondent communicated during this incident using Signal because Jorge Luis taught them it’s the safest encrypted messaging app.
attrs.additional_notes: The incident was important for convincing El Universal’s top editors that they need to act quickly to institute the security policies and protocols.

attrs.description: Former ICFJ Knight Fellow Gustavo Faleiros' InfoAmazonia launched a new Flood Alert platform to warn communities about possible floods (about 12 hours in advance) along the Madeira River in the Brazilian rainforest. The service sends alerts via Facebook Messenger and Telegram. This is the first time this type of service is offered in Western Brazil and the country's first social media-based flood alert tool (a SMS-based flood warning system exists in Rio de Janeiro).
topics: New technology solutions (sensors, drones, bots, etc)

attrs.description: Janine met Thalia Noboa Lamar, the founder of La Avena Comica, a YouTube channel modeled after Last Week Tonight with John Oliver. She's had two follow up calls with Thalia, coached her and her partner though the process of developing a PowerPoint deck to share with potential sponsors and investors. Janine introduced her to Maria Catalina Colmenares-Wiss, the Latin American investment analyst from the Media Development Investment Fund.
topics: Strengthened networks of journalists and technologists
attrs.additional_notes: IMPACT: The media laws in Ecuador are unique in the region in that they are far stricter for traditional media than for online media, which means that Thalia can produce political satire and commentary online in ways that traditional media cannot.

The El Universal correspondent in Morelia, Michoacán, noticed vehicles doing surveillance in front of her house in the middle of her night. She contacted her editor via a WhatsApp group that Jorge Luis started.  Jorge Luis saw the message and alerted El Universal’s deputy editor. El Universal then contacted the Mexican government who offered temporary protection to the journalist and investigated the incident.
attrs.additional_notes: The incident was important for convincing El Universal’s top editors that they need to act quickly to institute the security policies and protocols.

attrs.description: JL sends security policies and protocols docs to El Universal
attrs.additional_notes:
JL completed policy and protocols last week and sent docs. Newspapers need to schedule internal mtg to discuss, phone conference and then know if they accept or not.
If they accept, all new hires will receive docs.
JL says process with El Universal has been slow. Started in October 2015. Visited them in February  and used Salama with full newsroom - about 130 reporters and editors.
Expects review process to take 2-3 months.

This is the 15th story in the #GenderAND series. This story is important because the Dalit community has historically been repressed socially, economically, culturally and in all other possible aspects by the so-called upper caste groups in India. It's a community that is outside the caste structure and are also considered "untouchables" by the same so-called upper caste communities. This is a terrible thing also because caste is a major determining factor of Indian society just like class is in many other parts of the world.  In addition, violence against the Dalit community has increased in many parts of India, especially in places where Bhartiya Janata party (India's current ruling party and Hindu nationalist party) has been in power. Dalit women are vulnerable on several counts- their caste, class and gender. This piece explores what is means to be a Dalit women in contemporary India. One can say that it is similar to an exploration of what it means to be a Black woman in contemporary USA.
The fifth story in the series. (More to be added)

attrs.description: Janine Warner's Oct 2016 entrepreneurship MOOC with the Knight Center helped to inspire a participant to launch a new news site in Argentina called Antithesis.
attrs.additional_notes:
The magazine is particularly interesting because there are very few independent media outlets in Mendoza, the Argentinian border with Chile, and the magazine will be staffed by both Chilean and Argentinian journalists, thus displaying a level of unity between countries that have often identified themselves as rivals.  Jamina Travieso, wrote to explain how important the MOOC was in helping her understand how to launch a magazine called Antithesis. 

This new site was created by journalists who took the MOOC by Janine, James, and Mij; and a seminar at MediaParty by Mij, Fabiola and Patricia; quí su web: http://revistantitesis.com/, add notes about the site itself, which is focused on culture with multimedia narratives

Hace un tiempo, le contamos a ICFJ la historia de una alumna del MOOC. Ayer, finalmente lanzaron su medio, inspirado en el workshop que dimos con Patricia y Fabi y nuestro MOOC.

Aquí su web: http://revistantitesis.com/

Quería compartírtelo para que puedas incluirlo en tus reportes.

From Mij via email: The main reason why Antítesis is a relevant example is because there is a very few independent media outlets in Mendoza, the Argentinian frontier province with Chile. Their team will be conformed by Argentinian and Chilean journalists, a really good message for the endless rivality between both countries. 

Jimena Travieso's project will be focused in investigative reporting. "We investigate where only a few people do, we see where others don't see and we create text that leave a mark." Travieso's background is also interesting, she is an attorney with a master in journalism with experience in freedom of speech issues. 

Another interesting thing about Antítesis is that they will publish investigative reports among other "positive" content. Here's how Jimena explains it: "Antítesis are the opposites that make up our worldview: we investigate the consequences of corrupt acts, government inaction or bad state policies, but we also tell stories of people who, in the face of adversity, come out ahead, help, inspire and Are committed to changing their environment."

attrs.additional_notes:
Had first event on Saturday, immersive storytelling. Trialed the 360 guide, had answers to their questions, which revealed that the guide is effective. One of the designers for Dawn, she was concerned about learning the software, the guide has a section on software. 10 people came. Planned an hour long with questions, had an hour and a half session, because of so many questions. Sent 22 confirmations, will send 30 next time.
Will get feedback from them on what was helpful. Offered people to collaborate on their projects. Sending out a feedback form on what they learned, and will send out a form after two months on whether they used what they learned.

New stories from HT Labs team. From Nasr: "Flip side is that these are all one-off projects and it’s just this one team doing what they can. Not enough collaboration b/w them and traditional storytelling teams like the politics bureau, etc. This olympics stuff for ex, note the byline. Just Labs staff. None of their main sports correspondents.

All of this spearheaded by Labs lead Anand Katakam. Then there’s mojo video stuff led by Yusuf Omar. Our accomplishment is that we built the case and capacity for the org to hire such folks. If DFs had continued, these specialists would also have a forum to collaborate with good storytellers from across the newsroom. Right now, just limited to the few folks they’ve befriended."

attrs.additional_notes:
Did event happen? 

More info:
 Details about my trip to Santa Cruz, Bolivia, next week: I leave LA Saturday, Aug 5 and return the following Friday, Aug. 11. As usual, I'll check email and WhatsApp while traveling, but it will be hard for me to schedule any meetings that week. I'll be back in LA the following week with a much more flexible schedule. While in Bolivia, I will be working with the La Fundación para el Periodismo, which is headed by Renen Estessoro. (FYI - the initial connection came from our mutual friend, and I believe former ICFJ Fellow, Hena Cuevas). Renen originally asked me to do a series of workshops on investigative journalism - I recommended that he hire Fabiola for that instead and she and David Hidalgo split the 5 seminars between them and presented them in April. I am going now to do a follow up seminar on Entrepreneurial Journalism to help Renen develop an online media site at the Foundation, as well as to support the efforts of a selected group of participants from Fabiola and David's workshops. By wonderful coincidence, Carlos Huertes of Connectas will also be in Santa Cruz at the same time, so in addition to the 2-day workshop I will be running on Entrepreneurial journalism, I will also be sharing the stage with Carlos for an event at the Universidad NUR de Santa Cruz - he and I will each give 1.5 hour presentations that evening for students, faculty, and the public.

attrs.description: ARY and Dawn may have been inspired by Geo's Facebook Live videos
Janine Warner's MOOC (?) inspired her student Carlos Cordero to create this blog
attrs.additional_notes:
Need to check on the significance of this blog, confirm the description of the impact, when it was launched, what Janine did that triggered it.

It’s a message from another student who went on to launch a website. He send me this via Facebook:

Hola Janine. Le había comentado en diciembre (después del curso) que por ahí estaba desarrollando un proyecto. Se trata de este blog www.libroshistorias.com que ya lancé desde el 1o de mayo. Esta es la primera etapa. Por ahora lo estoy promocionando para ganar tráfico. El mercado es reducido, si consideramos que solo 2 de cada 10 personas leen un libro en últimos meses en Costa Rica. Pero igualmente es un nicho muy descuidado, con pocas publicaciones en medios y apenas hay un blog especializado de crítica, casi que solo para conocedores: filólogos, escritores, profesionales de literatura. En mi caso combinó reseñas e información de literatura clásica con contemporánea y best seller, así como relatos. Más adelante vendrán crónicas breves ("el móvil manda") y en una tercera etapa multimedia y más cosas. Conforme gane tráfico viene el tema de monetización. Como complemento: redes sociales con mi cuenta en Twitter, Instagram y Google+, y por supuesto Facebook donde espero alcanzar -antes de pagar publicidad- entre 200 y 300 seguidores. Es esta https://m.facebook.com/cacorderop/. Más adelante (en otro poco de tiempo) le contaré avances y aprendizajes. Juan Pablo Ferrari me conoce por cualquier cosa. Solo quería contarle porque del curso hay resultados que, aunque sencillos, es bueno saber, creo. Saludos y gracias por su atención.

Ravi helped her build two static bar graphs to go with her story on dengue. The concerned journalist sought out the team because she wanted to use data and do a strong story. This was her first attempt at data visualization. This visualization has data that would have made for a good interactive chart using data wrapper. But since third party embeds are not allowed even now, the team had to visualise on datawrapper  followed by taking a screenshot of the final visualization.
